Detailed Description

SlimThread is a class to encapsulate a thread.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SlimThread::SlimThread (  bool  suspended  ) 
 

Create a new thread, and according to suspended, start it or not. When the thread is starting, run() method is called. The thread terminate when run() terminate.

Parameters:
suspended must be true if the thread must be created suspended. You will heve to call resume() later to start it.
See also:
resume()

run()

Member Function Documentation

bool SlimThread::isSuspended (  void   ) 
 

Get the thread state

Returns:
true if this thread is in a suspended state, false if it is running

void SlimThread::resume (  void   ) 
 

Start a thread that was created suspended

See also:
SlimThread()

run()

virtual void SlimThread::run (  void   )  [virtual]
 

This function have to be implemented in your specialized class. This method has to contain the threaded code. Its termination make the thread terminate. THIS METHOD MUST NOT BE CALLED MANUALY
